ygData.subject: Re: How can I have elitism for each species?
ygData.msgSnippet: I m pretty sure that the species champions are protected from both mutation and crossover. There isn t a way to protect the top N individuals in the species,

I'm pretty sure that the species champions are protected from both mutation=
 and crossover.

There isn't a way to protect the top N individuals in the =
species, but it shouldn't be hard to add such a feature.

Make sure you loo=
k at the initial species configuration and adjust the CompatibilityThreshol=
d parameter accordingly so that the first few generations do not only conta=
in a single species.

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Jeff Clune <jeffclune@..=
.> wrote:
>
> Hi Jason-
> 
> Fair point. I am selecting things that seem to=
 me to be pretty different,
> and so I would expect most of the time they w=
ould be in different species
> and be preserved...but if they are in the sa=
me species I agree they
> shouldn't be preserved.
> 
> Assuming they are in=
 different species, is there another switch that needs
> to be thrown to pr=
eserve them or should they be preserved with my settings?
> 
> Also, am I r=
ight that I need to turn crossover off (by setting
> MutateOnlyProbability =
to 1), or does your code know not to cross elites?
> 
> Maybe I could go wi=
th another tack: Is there a way to increase the number of
> organisms that =
elitism protects unmutated? (e.g. the top N most fit in the
> pop)?
> 
> 
>=

> Best regards,

com, Jeff Clune <jeffclune@> wrote:
> >>> 
> >>> Hello all-
> >>> 
> >>> In=
 Jason's HyperNEAT C++ code,  I am trying to enforce that the champion of
>=
 >>> each species is preserved.
> >>> 
> >>> I have a population size of 15=
 (small, I know) and a SpeciesSizeTarget of 3
> >>> (to have 5 orgs per spe=
cies).
> >>> 
> >>> I set smallestSpeciesSizeWithElitism to 1.0 (so every s=
pecies should have
> >>> elitism), and then I rate orgs like so
> >>> 
> >>=
> Org/Fitness
> >>> 
> >>> A - 1000
> >>> B - 500
> >>> C - 500
> >>> All t=
he rest 1
> >>> 
> >>> Presumably A, B, and C should be preserved in the ne=
xt generation, but that
> >>> does not happen. I only get A.
> >>> 
> >>> I=
 figured maybe elitism only applied to mutation and not crossover, so I set=
